item.title: Organic cosmetics are becoming increasingly popular
item.description: A new report from TechSci Research, titled Global Organic Cosmetics Market By Product Type, By Point of Sale, By Region, Competition Forecast and Opportunities, 2011 - 2021, reveals that the global organic cosmetics market is expected to experience significant growth through 2021. This growth is driven by rising health concerns and a growing awareness of the negative effects of conventional cosmetic chemicals, coupled with the benefits offered by organic alternatives.

item.title: Everyday Minerals, a brand that is committed to being cruelty-free, has launched a new range of eyeshadows
item.description: Everyday Minerals (EM) prioritizes using the purest natural ingredients to create all-natural, vegan, and cruelty-free makeup. Their products are handmade in Texas and packaged in eco-friendly, recyclable materials. Source: Everyday Minerals blog. Vegan makeup is characterized by its exclusion of animal-derived ingredients and its non-reliance on animal testing. Ingredients like lanolin and collagen are examples of animal-derived components. A growing number of cosmetics companies are introducing vegan product lines or, like EM, adopting a fully vegan approach.

item.title: More than half of the worldwide facial aesthetics market is made up of Botox
item.description: The global demand for facial aesthetic procedures is growing, driven by consumers who are increasingly interested in their appearance and prefer less invasive treatments, according to a report on the Facial Aesthetics Market from 2016-2020 by Technavio. Technavio’s research shows that Botox holds the largest share of the facial aesthetics market, making up roughly 52% of the total. They attribute this dominance to changing cultural perceptions of beauty, higher disposable incomes, and the growing popularity of the brand.

item.title: Adapt your beauty routine to the changing weather conditions
item.description: Mintel Beauty & Personal Care (BPC) has recognized a new global beauty trend: seasonality. This trend reflects how different weather conditions influence beauty routines. Source: Mintel website. According to Mintel BPC, product launches related to this trend significantly increased from 9.8% in 2011 to 11.1% in 2014. This is particularly noticeable in facial skincare, where seasonal product launches grew from a mere 0.5% in 2009 to 1.2% in 2014. Jane Henderson, Global President of Mintel’s Beauty and Personal Care Division, notes a growing consumer awareness of how environmental changes impact their skin and hair.

item.title: Bourjois eyeshadows are available in matte, pearl, and shimmer finishes
item.description: Launched in 1912, Bourjois makeup is recognized for its signature small round compacts. The brand’s newest eyeshadows come in these iconic compacts and are offered in a range of matte, pearl, and shimmer finishes. The eight new eyeshadows glide onto eyelids smoothly when applied dry. If applied damp, the eyeshadows can be used to create precise lines, similar to eyeliner. 01 INGENUDE This shade is a delicate, slightly pearly off-white. It can be used to even out the look of eyelids.

item.title: Everyday Minerals introduces a new line of mineral color correctors
item.description: Source: Everyday Minerals website. Everyday Minerals claims to have formulated its finest mineral color correctors to date. These all-natural correctors feature jojoba esters, enabling them to conceal imperfections seamlessly without appearing heavy. The new Jojoba Color Correctors are offered in four shades, each formulated for a specific purpose. The pink-hued Brighten Color Corrector utilizes light-diffusing pigments to instantly illuminate dark circles under the eyes. The Cover Color Corrector, in a natural skin tone, can be used after foundation for concealing blemishes.

item.title: Arbonne is launching new product collections that are based on botanical ingredients
item.description: Arbonne International, a Swiss company known for its botanically-based personal care and wellness products, has introduced three new collections. Arbonne Intelligence Nourishing Facial Oil This light, dry oil is formulated with omega-3 and omega-6 fatty acids and potent antioxidants for radiant skin. The oil delivers exceptional hydration and acts as a nourishing “superfood” for your skin. RE9 Advanced for Men Set This comprehensive men’s skincare line features a Micro-Exfoliating Cleanser, Shave Cream, After-Shave Soothing Lotion, Anti-Aging Moisturizer with SPF 15, and Eye Repair Cream.

item.title: Inglot will be opening a new store in Singapore next month
item.description: Inglot, the cosmetics company, will open its doors in Singapore on October 1st. Source: Inglot Singapore Facebook page. The new store, located at Wisma Atria #B1-14, will host a grand opening on October 1st, according to Inglot Singapore’s Facebook page. On October 1st and 2nd, from 4-5 pm, Inglot makeup artist Ela Kocot will offer complimentary makeup demonstrations. Those interested in attending can register through the details provided on Inglot Singapore’s Facebook page.

item.title: 15 beauty tips for 2015 to celebrate the 15th anniversary of Giorgio Armani Beauty
item.description: Source: L’Oreal. Giorgio Armani Beauty is commemorating the 15th anniversary of its makeup line with a series of 15 instructional videos. Released periodically throughout the year, these short clips will feature Linda Cantello, Giorgio Armani’s International Make-Up Artist, sharing simple makeup techniques and expert advice.
